page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: { {Lapford}is a rural village in the middle of Devon. It lies beside the main road,half way between{Exeter}and{ { Barnstaple,}and is completely surrounded by rich farmland and fields specialising in dairying and some beef cattle.The village has about seven hundred people.Most of the houses are modern,having been built in the last forty years.There are still a few traditional cottages near the church in the centre of the village. The { {church }is mostly fifteenth century, with a magnificent screen and bench ends.The village is surrouded by farmland,but most people work in { {Exeter}or{Crediton}.There are only four shops,but daily bus and train service to Barnstaple and Exeter .Most people however travel in their own cars .
